Node.gloss: to hang|to throw from a rock|to impale|to dismember
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure, with several possibilities: = causative action by which humans put other humans to death, though the exact way is unsure; possibly interpretations include (1) hanging the body from a gibbet which results in dislocating some of the bones, (2) throwing the body down from a rock which results in dislocating some of the bones, (3) placing the body in a vertically position on a sharpened upright pole that will pierce it, (4) cutting the body to pieces

= to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect

= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin; ► burial place of Kish (קִישׁ) King Saul (שָׁאוּל) and Jonathan (יְהֹונָתָן)|= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

Node.definition: marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= giant man; ◄ Philistine (פְּלִשְׁתִּי) from Gath (גַּת) ► killed by David (דָּוִד)
= inhabitant of Gath (גַּת)
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp iron (בַּרְזֶל) head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer

= wooden bar, approximately 5 6 centimeters in diameter; ◄ part of weaving equiment; ► used for attaching the warp threads to and to roll up the finished cloth as it grows in length; ≈ associated with thickness and heaviness
= person whose occupation is weaving fabric
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the fives cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)
literally: a person of measure; hence: = an unusually tall or large person
= one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= one of the five projections of the human foot

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= state in which a countable entity is six in number
= state in which a countable entity is six in number
= state in which a countable entity is four in number
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
